      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void binData(int size, java.lang.Object[][] data)
      Take all data and "bin" it by the data value in the column being sorted by By default, it bins the rows by the string value of the given column - this can be altered by overriding the getIndex method to return some other string of your choice
      protected java.lang.Object[][] finalizeSort(int size, int columns, java.util.List<java.lang.String> keys)
      Finishes the sort by sorting the underlying data to match the way the particular column was sorted - My best explanation is: All the code before this sorted only the values for the specific column.
      protected java.lang.String getIndex(java.lang.Object[] row, int modelIndex)
      This gets the "key" for binning this data row.
      protected void handleOther()
      Handles some additional cases that need to be dealt with - always do this unless you don't want null handling and reversing behavior
      protected void initContainers()
      Initializes the various data containers that need to be cleared out for each new sort - just always do this
      java.lang.Object[][] sort(int size, int columns, java.lang.Object[][] data)
      Sorts columns
      protected void specificSort()
      Handles actually sorting the values provided - override to use a custom comparator

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        protected java.lang.String getIndex(java.lang.Object[] row,
                                    int modelIndex)
        This gets the "key" for binning this data row. Generally it's the string value of the column, but for specialized behavior you might overwrite to map it to some other string
        Parameters:
        row - Single row of the table
        modelIndex - column index of the table model
        Returns:
        Key to catalogue this data with

      • specificSort

        protected void specificSort()
        Handles actually sorting the values provided - override to use a custom comparator

        Sorts columns

      • initContainers

        protected void initContainers()
        Initializes the various data containers that need to be cleared out for each new sort - just always do this

      • handleOther

        protected void handleOther()
        Handles some additional cases that need to be dealt with - always do this unless you don't want null handling and reversing behavior

      • binData

        protected void binData(int size,
                       java.lang.Object[][] data)
        Take all data and "bin" it by the data value in the column being sorted by By default, it bins the rows by the string value of the given column - this can be altered by overriding the getIndex method to return some other string of your choice
        Parameters:
        size - Number of rows
        data - All data in the table

      • finalizeSort

        protected java.lang.Object[][] finalizeSort(int size,
                                            int columns,
                                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> keys)
        Finishes the sort by sorting the underlying data to match the way the particular column was sorted - My best explanation is: All the code before this sorted only the values for the specific column. This goes and sorts the table rows to match that.
        Parameters:
        size - Number of Rows
        columns - Number of columns
        keys - List of sorted keys for the selected column
        Returns:
        Sorted Table Data
